channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH

item.title: Report E-2024010438
item.description:
Report E-2024010438

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-26T15:11:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-17
  • City: NORWALK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 17, 2024, one (1) 50-pound bag of UN3262 was torn in transit and released approximately twenty-five (25) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the site. ER personnel utilized absorbents, hand tools, and a vacuum unit to remediate the powder-impacted trailer. All waste was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums staged at the terminal for future disposal.

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FIRST RESPONDER WAS PAGED TO LOCATION, HE DONNED APPROPRIATE PPE AND ARRIVED ON SCENE WHERE HE FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND CORRECT RESPONSE SHEET TO CONTAIN, SOLIDIFY, AND CLEAN UP THE SPILLED HAZMAT. HE THEN BROUGHT ALL AFFECTED MATERIAL BACK TO DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL PROCEDURE.

item.title: Report E-2024010342
item.description:
Report E-2024010342

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: BRUNSWICK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SAFETY-KLEEN SYSTEMS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: This was the last pick up for the day and when the driver was doing his pick up the customer added more paint waste to the drum and he loaded it on his truck. The drive was about an hour back to the facility to unload for the end of the day. He arrive at approximately 1730 and when he opened the door to unload they noticed the drum was swelling up. The team at the facility emidiatly called for a team to come out and and address the container. The drum expanded to the point of failure at about 1830 before the team could arrive to address the situation. The bottom of the container failed and the contents was released into the truck with around 10 gallons making it to the pavement. They were able to contained it with absorbents and booms from spreading. The team arrived around 1930 to perform the clean up. They dawned the proper PPE and proceeded to clean up the material and overpacking the container to be shipped and disposed of properly. The crew was able to complete this around 2200.

item.title: Report E-2024010358
item.description:
Report E-2024010358

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a 2gal release of UN1307, Unisol® Liquid Red B, from a 55gal metal drum on the dock. The cause was due to a forklift accident. The SDS was reviewed with terminal personnel who felt comfortable cleaning the release with oil dri and proper PPE. Terminal personnel placed the waste into a 65gal poly drum in the facilities waste area for them to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023120457
item.description:
Report E-2023120457

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-26T15:11:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-12
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ERTS was contacted about a spill that occurred on the dock. The spill consists of (1) 55-gallon metal drum containing Chemlok 205 adhesive liquid, which was punctured by a forklift during dock ops, causing approximately 15 gallons to release from the container. No Drains, Soils or waterways were impacted.
